Therefore, the most appropriate next step in management is to start a low dose of oral prednisone, a corticosteroid, to reduce inflammation and prevent vision loss. Muscle biopsy can confirm the diagnosis, but is not necessary to start treatment. Electromyography and antibody screening are not capable of diagnosing giant cell arteritis.
